title: Fortnite Chapter 2 update is downloading now, story trailer leaks
text:
The Fortnite party is about to restart

Considering how fast things are moving now Fortnite might be back up in just a few hours, as fans get a good look at the new map.

It looked like maybe the Battle Pass trailer leak would be the only Fortnite news we got today, but not only has the story trailer also leaked but a new patch is now available for the game if you check for an update.

It’s just over 9GB on PlayStation 4, so not that big, but even once it’s installed you still can’t actually play the game. Or at least not as we type this.

When the game does go online though we fear for what it’ll do to the Internet. Over 7 million people watched the Season X finale on Sunday and since then the hype has only grown, so if the servers manage to cope with the initial flood of fans it’s going to be a minor miracle.

The story trailer isn’t very long but it does show the new version of the island, four new characters, and the revamped battle bus.

The power station seems to be leaking something into the water, which ties in with the generally water-based theme of the new season, which allows for swimming, boats, and fishing for the first time.

According to dataminers the new map is called Appolo, although whether that’s a typo of Apollo or not we’re not sure.

At the moment, at 10am on Tuesday, the livestream is still just showing the same black hole it’s been stuck on since Sunday evening but at this rate the game will probably be back before the previously predicted Thursday morning comeback.
